edu.rit.pjmr

Class Combiner<K,V extends Vbl>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.util.Map<K,V>
      • edu.rit.pjmr.Combiner<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - Key data type.
    V - Value data type; must implement interface Vbl.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Streamable, Vbl, Cloneable

    public class Combiner<K,V extends Vbl>
extends Map<K,V>
implements Vbl
    Class Combiner provides a combiner in the Parallel Java Map Reduce Framework. See class PjmrJob for further information about configuring combiners as part of a PJMR job.

    A combiner is a mapping from keys to values. The key can be any object that is suitable for use as a key in a hashed data structure. The value must be an object that implements interface Vbl, which is the interface for an object that supports reduction. The basic operation is add(key,value); this absorbs the given (key, value) pair into the combiner by reducing the given value into the value associated with the given key inside the combiner.

    To be suitable for use as a key in a hashed data structure: (1) The key object's class must define the equals() and hashCode() methods in the proper manner. (2) When an object is used as a key, the state of the object must not be altered.

    A combiner is itself a Vbl. The reduce() method absorbs every (key, value) pair in a given combiner into this combiner.

    Note: Class Combiner is not multiple thread safe. Any necessary thread synchronization is handled by the caller.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Combiner

        public Combiner()
        Construct a new combiner.

      • Combiner

        public Combiner(Combiner<K,V> combiner)
        Construct a new combiner that is a copy of the given combiner. Tthe new combiner's keys are set to the key references in the given combiner. The new combiner's values are set to clones of the values in the given combiner.
        Parameters:
        combiner - Combiner to copy.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(K key,
       V value)
        Add the given (key, value) pair into this combiner. If the key does not yet exist in this combiner, a new pair (key, v) is first added, where v is the value returned by the initialValue() method. If the given value is non-null, the value is reduced into the value associated with the key inside this combiner (either the existing value, or the newly created value).
        Parameters:
        key - Key; must be non-null.
        value - Value; may be null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if key is null. Thrown if value is non-null but the value associated with key inside this combiner is null.

      • clone

        public Object clone()
        Create a clone of this shared variable. The clone contains references to the keys in this combiner. The clone contains clones of the values in this combiner.
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Vbl
        Overrides:
        clone in class Object
        Returns:
        The cloned object; a combiner.

      • set

        public void set(Vbl vbl)
        Set this shared variable to the given shared variable. This combiner's keys are set to the key references in the given combiner. This combiner's values are set to clones of the values in the given combiner.
        Specified by:
        set in interface Vbl
        Parameters:
        vbl - Shared variable; a combiner.
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the class of vbl is not compatible with the class of this shared variable.

      • reduce

        public void reduce(Vbl vbl)
        Reduce the given shared variable into this shared variable. The two combiners are combined together, and the result is stored in this combiner.
        Specified by:
        reduce in interface Vbl
        Parameters:
        vbl - Shared variable; a combiner.
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the class of vbl is not compatible with the class of this shared variable.

      • copyValue

        protected V copyValue(V value)
        Copy the given value. The copyValue() method in class Combiner returns a clone of the given value.
        Overrides:
        copyValue in class Map<K,V extends Vbl>
        Parameters:
        value - Value to copy.
        Returns:
        Copy of value.

      • initialValue

        protected V initialValue(K key,
             V value)
        The add() method calls the initialValue() method when a certain key is being added to this combiner for the first time. The initialValue() method returns a new object which is the initial value to be associated with the new key.

        The initialValue() method in class Combiner does the following. If value is null, null is returned. Otherwise, a new instance of the value's class is returned; the new instance is created by the class's no-argument constructor. If this is not the desired behavior, write a subclass of class Combiner and override the initialValue() method.

        Parameters:
        key - Key that is being added; non-null.
        value - Value that is being added; may be null.
        Returns:
        Initial value to be associated with the key, or null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the value's class does not have a no-argument constructor, or if an instance of that class cannot be created.
